snippet: Researchers in China have studied the shinglelike structure of butterfly wings, which they say are especially efficient in absorbing sunlight, and have built a prototype based on it.
abstract: DrTongxiang Fan study presented at a meeting of the American Chemical Society finds that butterfly wings act as sophisticated collectors of solar energy that help the insects stay warm; researchers note that the wings' shinglelike structure could provide valuable clues into developing better solar technology.
lead_paragraph: Researchers in China have studied the shinglelike structure of butterfly wings, which they say are especially efficient in absorbing sunlight, and have built a prototype based on it.
